content: Current Leadership of India - 2024 Update President of India: Droupadi Murmu - Assumed office: July 25, 2022 - 15th President of India - First tribal woman to hold the position - Born: June 20, 1958 - Previously: Governor of Jharkhand (2015-2021) - Succeeded: Ram Nath Kovind (14th President, 2017-2022) Prime Minister of India: Narendra Modi - Assumed current term: June 9, 2024 (third term) - 14th Prime Minister of India since May 26, 2014 - Member of Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Vice President of India: Jagdeep Dhankhar - Assumed office: August 11, 2022 - 14th Vice President of India Key Facts: - Droupadi Murmu is the second woman President of India (after Pratibha Patil) - She is the youngest person to become President (at age 64) - She won the 2022 presidential election defeating Yashwant Sinha - Ram Nath Kovind was the previous president (2017-2022) - Droupadi Murmu belongs to the Santhal tribe from Odisha

Current UK Government Leadership - Updated 2024 Prime Minister: Keir Starmer - Position: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom - Start Date: July 5, 2024 - Political Party: Labour Party - Previous Position: Leader of the Opposition (2020-2024) - Background: Former Director of Public Prosecutions and human rights lawyer Recent Prime Ministers (for context): - Rishi Sunak (Conservative): October 25, 2022 - July 5, 2024 - Liz Truss (Conservative): September 6, 2022 - October 25, 2022 (45 days - shortest serving PM) - Boris Johnson (Conservative): July 24, 2019 - September 6, 2022 Key Facts about Keir Starmer: - Led Labour Party to victory in 2024 general election - First Labour Prime Minister since Gordon Brown (2007-2010) - Known for his legal background and moderate politics - Succeeded in ending 14 years of Conservative government Last Updated: January 2025
